SEARCH
Package io.github.ulalax.zmq.core

Class ZmqStructs

java.lang.Object
io.github.ulalax.zmq.core.ZmqStructs
public final class ZmqStructs extends Object
Memory layouts for ZeroMQ native structures.

This class provides StructLayout definitions for ZeroMQ's native C structures, enabling proper memory mapping when using Java's Foreign Function & Memory API. These layouts must exactly match the binary structure of the corresponding C structures.

Defined Structures:

  • ZMQ_MSG_LAYOUT - Layout for zmq_msg_t (64 bytes, 8-byte aligned)
  • ZMQ_POLLITEM_WINDOWS_LAYOUT - Layout for zmq_pollitem_t on Windows
  • ZMQ_POLLITEM_UNIX_LAYOUT - Layout for zmq_pollitem_t on Unix/Linux/macOS

Usage Example:


 // Allocate memory for a ZMQ message
 try (Arena arena = Arena.ofConfined()) {
     MemorySegment msg = arena.allocate(ZmqStructs.ZMQ_MSG_LAYOUT);
     LibZmq.msgInit(msg);
     // Use message...
     LibZmq.msgClose(msg);
 }

 // Allocate array of poll items
 try (Arena arena = Arena.ofConfined()) {
     StructLayout layout = ZmqStructs.getPollItemLayout();
     MemorySegment items = arena.allocate(layout, 10); // 10 items
     // Configure and use poll items...
 }
Since:
1.0.0

  • Field Details

    • ZMQ_MSG_LAYOUT

      public static final StructLayout ZMQ_MSG_LAYOUT
      Memory layout for the zmq_msg_t structure.

      This layout defines the structure of a ZeroMQ message object. The structure is 64 bytes in size with 8-byte alignment, consisting of eight 8-byte fields. This matches the C definition of zmq_msg_t.

      Important: This layout must exactly match the native structure size and alignment. Any mismatch will cause memory corruption or crashes.

      See Also:
      • LibZmq.msgInit(java.lang.foreign.MemorySegment)
      • LibZmq.msgClose(java.lang.foreign.MemorySegment)

    • ZMQ_MSG_SIZE

      public static final long ZMQ_MSG_SIZE
      The size of zmq_msg_t structure in bytes.

      This constant is derived from ZMQ_MSG_LAYOUT and always equals 64 bytes.

    • ZMQ_POLLITEM_WINDOWS_LAYOUT

      public static final StructLayout ZMQ_POLLITEM_WINDOWS_LAYOUT
      Memory layout for zmq_pollitem_t structure on Windows platforms.

      This layout defines the polling structure for Windows, which differs from Unix systems in the file descriptor field size:

      • socket: pointer (8 bytes) - ZeroMQ socket
      • fd: SOCKET/long (8 bytes) - Windows socket handle
      • events: short (2 bytes) - Events to poll for
      • revents: short (2 bytes) - Events that occurred
      • padding: 32 bits - Alignment padding
      See Also:
      • ZMQ_POLLITEM_UNIX_LAYOUT
      • getPollItemLayout()

    • ZMQ_POLLITEM_UNIX_LAYOUT

      public static final StructLayout ZMQ_POLLITEM_UNIX_LAYOUT
      Memory layout for zmq_pollitem_t structure on Unix/Linux/macOS platforms.

      This layout defines the polling structure for Unix-like systems:

      • socket: pointer (8 bytes) - ZeroMQ socket
      • fd: int (4 bytes) - Unix file descriptor
      • events: short (2 bytes) - Events to poll for
      • revents: short (2 bytes) - Events that occurred
      See Also:
      • ZMQ_POLLITEM_WINDOWS_LAYOUT
      • getPollItemLayout()

  • Method Details

    • getPollItemLayout

      public static StructLayout getPollItemLayout()
      Returns the platform-appropriate memory layout for zmq_pollitem_t.

      This method detects the current operating system and returns the correct layout for the platform. Windows uses ZMQ_POLLITEM_WINDOWS_LAYOUT, while Unix-like systems use ZMQ_POLLITEM_UNIX_LAYOUT.

      Returns:
      the StructLayout for zmq_pollitem_t appropriate for the current platform
      See Also:
      • ZMQ_POLLITEM_WINDOWS_LAYOUT
      • ZMQ_POLLITEM_UNIX_LAYOUT
